Bash(gh issue create --repo MattCordell/ecl-formatter --title "Create GitHub Pages web interface for ECL formatting" --body "$\(cat <<''EOF''
## Description
Create a simple web page hosted on GitHub Pages that provides browser-based ECL formatting using the same rules as the VS Code extension.

## Features
- Single-page application with minimal dependencies
- Text input area for pasting ECL expressions
- "Format" button to apply formatting
- Formatted output displayed in a result area
- Copy-to-clipboard functionality for the result

## Technical Approach
- Bundle the parser and formatter for browser use \(esbuild with browser target\)
- Host on GitHub Pages from `/docs` folder or `gh-pages` branch
- Pure HTML/CSS/JS - no framework required

## UI Mockup
```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  ECL Formatter                              │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  ┌───────────────────────────────────────┐  │
│  │ Paste ECL expression here...          │  │
│  │                                       │  │
│  │                                       │  │
│  └───────────────────────────────────────┘  │
│                                             │
│  [ Format ]                                 │
│                                             │
│  ┌───────────────────────────────────────┐  │
│  │ Formatted output appears here...      │  │
│  │                                       │  │
│  │                                       │  │
│  └───────────────────────────────────────┘  │
│                                   [ Copy ]  │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Page loads and renders correctly
- [ ] Format button applies same rules as VS Code extension
- [ ] Error messages displayed for invalid ECL
- [ ] Works in modern browsers \(Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge\)
- [ ] Responsive design for mobile use
EOF
\)")
